result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:40 PM Defendant Edlando M Watson in court, in custody.  Attorney Catherine Dorl in court for Edlando M Watson.  Prosecuting attorney Trisha L Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments by parties. Court directed that $500 previously posted is NOT to be applied to the bail set today as language in prior hearing does not clearly indicate if bail was to have remained on file or been forfeited.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 11:30 am.

01:53 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
